snippet: Last year, a federal district judge ruled that the process was “cruel and unusual.” The panel, however, said the ruling failed on technical grounds.
abstract: Federal appeals court overturns 2014 ruling that California's system for reviewing capital punishment sentences constituted cruel and unusual punishment; court says 2014 decision was technically flawed, setback for opponents of death penalty, although many analysts say similar argument has potential to reach Supreme Court.
lead_paragraph: Last year, a federal district judge ruled that the process was “cruel and unusual.” The panel, however, said the ruling failed on technical grounds.

headline.main: Federal Appeals Panel Overturns Anti-Death Penalty Ruling in California
headline.print_headline: Appeals Panel Rejects Ruling That Could Have Voided California Death Sentences
